item.title: Pottersfield Road sign was apparently vandalised on 23/12/23., 4th January
item.description:
Outside No. 1 Pottersfield Road at junction of New Road. The sign was found down Station Road that evening. Not sure if anyone else has reported this, no record of it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pottersfield Road, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 4th January
item.description:
FMS rcvd 30.12.23 - Every time there is wind the tree sheds branches which fall onto our driveway. This poses a risk to our children, people waiting at the bus stop and also to our cars. We would ask that the tree is fully checked and dead branches removed. I would appreciate a response on this issue as it has been an ongoing concern for safety.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A board belonging to BOOKS & INK obstructing the pavement, 4th January
item.description:
In the MIDDLE of the pavement outside Books & Ink. 6 North St, Winchcombe. I went in ti ask the female owner if she could please relocate the board. She was very challenging, saying that someone had moved it. Si I said I could wait while she repositioned it to a place which would allow the safe passage of mums with pushchairs, disabled folks in mobility scooters and wheelchair users. She didn't move saying again that someone had moved it. I told her I myself had just had to walk in the road around it. She just sneered saying it was better than parked cars. I didn't actually see the relevance of that. She really embarrassed herself but after quite a while she did go and move it slightly. Passive aggressive...."you have a lovely new year too". I feel that she will put it again on the pavement causing an obstruction....merely because she is that way out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13a, North Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Fly tipping - more cardboard, 4th January
item.description:
More cardboard has been dumped here. I reported it before Christmas and it was cleared v quickly. However some lazy so and so has dumped more cardboard in the same location.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 162A, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path/Way doesn't match map problem, 4th January
item.description:
I manage Crickley Hill nature reserve and we are planning some tree felling work to improve the habitat for adders (among others). There is an old pedestrian gate on the south side of Cold Slad Lane (near Clair-de-Lune House, GL3 4UQ) marked by a question mark on the screenshot below. The gate hasn’t been used for a long time, and doesn’t go anywhere, just into impassable scrub and trees. It isn’t marked on the online GCC PRoW map (where the screenshot is from), but I’m aware the online map isn’t definitive. I was wondering if you could confirm whether or not there is a public right of way at this location?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Un-attended works for months, 4th January
item.description:
Highways have begun works under the paving slabs on the Promenade, as seen in the attached photographs, these were started and have remained untouched for months. The barriers are totally unstable, have fallen over and are now permitting any person/child/animal to fall in to the deep hole. When will these works be completed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Promenade, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large trees overhanding and dropping branches, 4th January
item.description:
Good morning, Yesterday i reported an issue with blocked road side drains and water flooding down our side road to 'Sheepshead Row' now called 'leckhmapton Lodge'. Please also note, the trees on the main road, also coming down our drive (this is also public highway and IS NOT a private road) are hugely overgrown and branches keep falling on the road which have to be moved. The used to be cut regularly, however, haven't been for some 3/4 years now and are dangerous. The road, leading to Field Cottage is also a public footpath which bring with it a danger to life when windy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
